chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
L: Language

Goal:
forall (P cP1 : context -> Prop) (cP2 : Ensemble context), at_least P cP1 -> at_least P (Intersection context cP1 cP2)

Premises:
at_least = fun P cP : context -> Prop => forall Phi : context, cP Phi -> P Phi : (context -> Prop) -> (context -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope]
Intersection : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Ensemble U
context = fun L : Language => expr -> Prop : Language -> Type Argument L is implicit and maximally inserted
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
at_least_self : forall P : context -> Prop, at_least P P
ssrbool.elimNf : forall (P : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> negb b = false -> P
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
ssrbool.elimNTF : forall (P : Prop) (b c : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> negb b = c -> if c then ~ P else P
Disjoint_rect : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Type), ((forall x : U, ~ Ensembles.In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), ((forall x : U, ~ Ensembles.In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), ((forall x : U, ~ Ensembles.In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_rec : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Set), ((forall x : U, ~ Ensembles.In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
le_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Prop), P n -> (forall m : nat, n <= m -> P m -> P (S m)) -> forall n0 : nat, n <= n0 -> P n0
Union_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union U B C u -> P u
Union_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union U B C u -> P u
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
Intersection_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U B x -> Ensembles.In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u
Intersection_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U B x -> Ensembles.In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
Inductive reflect (P : Prop) : bool -> Set := ReflectT : P -> Bool.reflect P true | ReflectF : ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false For reflect: Argument scopes are [type_scope bool_scope] For ReflectT: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For ReflectF: Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
Inhabited_ind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
Inhabited_sind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), (forall x : U, Ensembles.In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
inj_pairT2 : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Type) (p : U) (x y : P p), existT P p x = existT P p y -> x = y
empty_context = fun L : Language => Empty_set expr : forall L : Language, context Argument L is implicit and maximally inserted
eq_dep_eq : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Type) (p : U) (x y : P p), eq_dep U P p x p y -> x = y
Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), Forall P nil
Inductive BoolSpec (P Q : Prop) : bool -> Prop := BoolSpecT : P -> BoolSpec P Q true | BoolSpecF : Q -> BoolSpec P Q false For BoolSpecT: Argument P is implicit For BoolSpecF: Argument Q is implicit For BoolSpec: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope bool_scope] For BoolSpecT: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _] For BoolSpecF: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} For sig: Argument A is implicit For exist: Argument A is implicit For sig: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For exist: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ _]

```coq
intros P cP1 cP2 H.
apply at_least_self.
intros Phi HPhi.
apply H.
exact HPhi.
Qed.
```

original: intros P cP1 cP2 H. apply at_least_self. intros Phi HPhi. apply H. apply HPhi.
